20110131131014.000|20110131131017.000|TR0|They're chanting for the overthrow of 
20110131131017.000|20110131131019.000|TR0|President Mubarak.  An army armored 
20110131131019.000|20110131131022.000|TR0|personnel carrier came racing into the 
20110131131022.000|20110131131024.000|TR0|central square, in the middle of the city, 
20110131131024.000|20110131131027.000|TR0|very close to where the protesters were, 
20110131131027.000|20110131131029.000|TR0|they were firing its heavy machine gun, a 
20110131131029.000|20110131131031.000|TR0|60-cal machine gun.  It makes a very loud, 
20110131131031.000|20110131131034.000|TR0|intimidating noise.
20110131131034.000|20110131131036.000|TR0|
20110131131036.000|20110131131039.000|TR0|It wasn't firing directly at the 
20110131131039.000|20110131131041.000|TR0|protesters, what it appeared to be doing 
20110131131041.000|20110131131043.000|TR0|is chasing away a group of protesters who 
20110131131043.000|20110131131046.000|TR0|gathered near one of the city's hotels.  
20110131131046.000|20110131131048.000|TR0|This is the first time that we have seen 
20110131131048.000|20110131131051.000|TR0|the army take such an aggressive position, 
20110131131051.000|20110131131053.000|TR0|if you will, around protesters.  This was 
20110131131053.000|20110131131056.000|TR0|an effort to intimidate and scare back the 
20110131131056.000|20110131131058.000|TR0|protesters who were near the hotel.  It 
20110131131058.000|20110131131100.000|TR0|wasn't clear what their intentions were.
20110131131100.000|20110131131103.000|TR0|
20110131131103.000|20110131131105.000|TR0|But the army, until now, has generally sat 
20110131131105.000|20110131131108.000|TR0|at the side of the road, guarding 
20110131131108.000|20110131131110.000|TR0|government buildings, not taking actions 
20110131131110.000|20110131131113.000|TR0|such as driving at high speed, firing 
20110131131113.000|20110131131115.000|TR0|heavy machine guns, T.J.
20110131131115.000|20110131131117.000|TR0|
20110131131117.000|20110131131120.000|TR0|HOLMES:  Nic, was this the only army

20110131131134.000|20110131131137.000|TR0|parts of the city, not so far away at all.

20110131131939.000|20110131131941.000|TR0|KURTZER:  Well, I don't know if we can

20110131132113.000|20110131132116.000|TR0|of Egyptians who value stability and who 
20110131132116.000|20110131132118.000|TR0|don't want to see the country turn into 
20110131132118.000|20110131132120.000|TR0|chaos. It's hard to measure that in a 
20110131132120.000|20110131132123.000|TR0|society where you don't have an open 
20110131132123.000|20110131132125.000|TR0|political system, but I would also suggest

20110131132137.000|20110131132140.000|TR0|if it's a stability that opens up the
